value.name: Activity
value.description: Type of work involved

value.name: Application Launch Instructions
value.description: Instructions to launch the specified application

value.name: Application Start Information
value.description: The path to execute the application

value.name: Application Type
value.description: The type of application on which to give feedback

value.name: Area Path
value.description: The area of the product with which this bug is associated

value.name: Assigned To
value.description: The person currently working on this bug

value.name: Automated Test Id
value.description: The ID of the test that automates this test case

value.name: Automated Test Name
value.description: The name of the test that automates this test case

value.name: Automated Test Storage
value.description: The assembly containing the test that automates this test case

value.name: Automated Test Type
value.description: The type of the test that automates this test case

value.name: Business Value
value.description: The business value for the customer when the epic is released

value.name: Completed Work
value.description: The number of units of work that have been spent on this bug

value.name: Description
value.description: Description or acceptance criteria for this epic to be considered complete

value.name: Due Date
value.description: The date by which this issue needs to be closed

value.name: Effort
value.description: The estimated effort to implemented the epic

value.name: Finish Date
value.description: The date to finish the task

value.name: Found In
value.description: The build in which the bug was found

value.name: History
value.description: Discussion thread plus automatic record of changes

value.name: Integration Build
value.description: The build in which the bug was fixed

value.name: Issue
value.description: Used to highlight the shared step, e.g., to mark it as an issue

value.name: Iteration Path
value.description: The iteration within which this bug will be fixed

value.name: Original Estimate
value.description: Initial value for Remaining Work - set once, when work begins

value.name: Priority
value.description: Business importance. 1=must fix; 4=unimportant.

value.name: Rating
value.description: Overall rating provided as part of feedback response

value.name: Reason
value.description: The reason why the bug is in the current state

value.name: Remaining Work
value.description: An estimate of the number of units of work remaining to complete this bug

value.name: Repro Steps
value.description: How to see the bug. End by contrasting expected with actual behavior.

value.name: Resolved Reason
value.description: The reason why the bug was resolved

value.name: Risk
value.description: Uncertainty in epic

value.name: Severity
value.description: Assessment of the effect of the bug on the project

value.name: Stack Rank
value.description: Work first on items with lower-valued stack rank. Set in triage.

value.name: Start Date
value.description: The date to start the task

value.name: State
value.description: New = for triage; Active = not yet fixed; Resolved = fixed not yet verified; Closed = fix verified.

value.name: Steps
value.description: Steps required to perform the test

value.name: Story Points
value.description: The size of work estimated for fixing the bug

value.name: System Info
value.description: Test context, provided automatically by test infrastructure

value.name: Target Date
value.description: The target date for completing the epic

value.name: Test Suite Audit
value.description: Captures the test suite audit trail.

value.name: Test Suite Type
value.description: Specifies the category of the test suite.

value.name: Time Criticality
value.description: How does the business value decay over time. Higher values make the epic more time critical

value.name: Title
value.description: Stories affected and how

value.name: Value Area
value.description: The type should be set to Business primarily to represent customer-facing issues. Work to change the architecture should be added as a User Story
